name: Hotel Wilhelmina

reviews.text: We took a three-night stay in a double room at this excellent hotel in late January 2006 and found it to be totally different to the three reviews already posted.
reviews.title: I liked the Aadam Wilhelmina!
Hotel, it was a diaster
reviews.text: It was very good value for money, adjacent to the No. 2 tram route which gets you to and from the centre of Amsterdam briskly, cheaply and safely. In fact, so conveniently was it situated that we never actually took the tram to the city centre in the mornings, but only used it for travelling back at night!

reviews.title: A total rip off
reviews.text: Travellers who must have a lift/elevator should perhaps not go there if using a minimal amount of effort is a problem, although we had to climb two sets of stairs to our room and only found the turn at the top of the second flight of stairs a bit of a challenge with narrow steps, but overseas visitors might like to consider that the traditional narrow but tall configuration of Dutch buildings makes this necessary. The able-bodied should NOT find it a challenge.

reviews.title: not very nice
reviews.text: The bed was fine, as was the cleanliness of the room, the bathroom, and the breakfast area. The proprietors were friendly, and we shall certainly be going back there again, not least because the standard of clientele (at least when we were there) meant that there was no noise during the night, which is worth a lot!

reviews.title: Ripped off
reviews.text: The hotel was a diaster, we did not get what we paid for. I was taken awa for a suprise weekend for my birthday and it was more of a dissapointment for him who book the hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent 2* hotel
reviews.text: This is a hotel with basic but good, clean facilities. The staff were friendly and helpful both when booking and while staying at the hotel. Breakfast was a simple traditional cold buffett that made a good starter for the days exporing. Being only about 75 metres from the tram stop this hotel is an ideal base to explore Amsterdam and at a price far less than a city centre hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent Amsterdam Hotel
reviews.text: An excellent Two star hotel - should actually be a three star. Friendly star, super rooms and great room rates. Breakfast is a good spread buffet.

reviews.title: The mice love it!
reviews.text: When you book this hotel online, they send you an e-mail informing you that they have earmarked a 'nice' room. There was nothing nice about our stay. All the negative comments about this hotel on TripAdvisor are true (would we have seen them before we booked!). It is musty and dirty. Carpets have seen better days. Our bedspread was stained, sockets didn't work, there were bare wires on lights, and taps were loose. Double beds are composed of two singles pushed together. There were no curtains on bathroom windows, no toiletries (not even bars of soap, just liquid soap dispensers), the stairs were treacherously steep, and the breakfast mediocre. All this for 160 Euros a night!

The management are extremely arrogant and rude and make no secret of the fact that money is the prime concern. Payment is demanded upfront within minutes of arrival and if you want to use a credit card they whack you for 6 percent surcharge. Despite the high cost of the rooms, they charge 20 Euros per night for a kettle/tea/coffee and also ask 20 Euros as deposit for the plastic keys. When we asked to see the room as a courtesy before we paid, we were told that even if we didn't like it we would still have to pay for the nights reserved as the hotel had our credit card details.
reviews.title: Very disappointing hotel - not good value for money
Overpriced Hotel, and Arrogent Management
reviews.text: We had booked online for 4 nights and stuck it for 2. Early morning on the third day, we were greeted by the sight of a mouse helping himself to the sugar next to the bed. Far from being concerned, the manager said no one had ever complained about vermin before and expressed scepticism of our complaint. After an unpleasant argument, we left and we were refused any kind of refund. We booked via the helpful Tourist Info Office 2 nights at the Hotel Torens in central Amsterdam, which was very expensive (compounded by the lack of refund). But at least the quality of the hotel and the courtesy of the staff helped wash away the memory of the Wilhemina. The first thing we did was have a shower!
This hotel is seriously bad news and should, in our view, be removed from travel websites. I've personally never experienced anything like it.
reviews.title: Very Pleased
ripped off
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aadam Wilhemina in April 2006. Our first impression upon entering was the musty smell. We had asked for a non-smoking room and assumed we would get one as we had not been advised otherwise, however all rooms are smoking and it was too late. The room itself smelled very strongly of smoke and the bedspread had multiple burn marks. The smell of smoke on the blankets is intolerable to a non-smoker. I must admit the sheets were changed every day but sometimes they were so old and threadbare they actually had holes in them.

description: Hotel Wilhelmina is a pleasant and charming, Superior 2 Star Hotel. Most of our large comfortable rooms have Private Facilities - Shower & Toilet, Colour Cable TV, Direct Dial Telephone etc. Hotel is centrally located within walking distance (12-15 minutes) of main Museums, Concert Hall & the Vondelpark and near the RAI Exhibition Centre, World Trade & Fashion Centre. The efficient management, inspired by great hospitality, will do all to enhance the pleasure and comfort of your stay.
